p-numeracy.text: Many students are concerned about their maths skills. How prepared do you feel in terms of mathematics and numeracy?

answers.info: Wonderful these will stand you  in good stead during your studies.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: These are skills that can be developed. We encourage you to attend an appropriate learning workshop. Details can be found here. It is normal to be anxious about Maths.
answers.label: no

answers.info: Excellent.

uhiw-policies1.text: Are you confident that you understand the policies of the uni, e.g. Assessment of Course Work Policy, Withdrawal without Financial Penalty Policy?

answers.info: Wonderful, it is really important to have good awareness of these.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: You will find links to some policies in course subject/unit profile/outline please make yourself familiar with them as they could be important.

answers.info: Send an email to this address, email address here. Don't forget to include your phone number if you want them to call you.
answers.label: yes please

p-writingassessment.text: Many of your assessments at university are written; for example essays, reports and discussion papers based on research. Is this an area you are confident with?

answers.info: That's good to hear, let's move on.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: These are skills that can be developed we encourage you to attend an appropriate workshop. Details can be found here. It is normal to be anxious about writing your assessments.
answers.label: umm..

sa-intro.text: Nearly done, this is the last section.

lb-cultural.text: Sometime students tell us they have cultural obligations which impact on their attendance at compulsory classes such as residential schools/on-campus labs and /or availability for compulsory placements.&& Do you think this may be of concern to you at some stage?

answers.info: You may have a large extended family and be expected to participate in family events. Cultural responsibilities can be time consuming. You should talk about this with your pathways support officer.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: Planning ahead of time is always the best approach to be sure that possible solutions are explored so that essential course requirements and other responsibilities can be met. You should talk about this with your pathways support officer.
answers.label: maybe a bit

uhiw-advice.text: Would you like some course advice?

answers.info: Send an email requesting course advice to this address, email address here. Don't forget to include your phone number if you want them to call you back.
answers.label: yes

sa-counselling.text: If you need to talk to someone we have counsellors available face to face, by phone, or email. Want to know more?

answers.info: contact details
answers.label: yes

uhiw-prestudy2.text: Are you applying (or would you like to apply) for Recognised Prior Learning for your previous study or work experience?

answers.info: Check out the course calculator found at url here or speak to the Student Centre.
answers.label: yes

p-computerskills.text: You will use a range of computer skills at university such as email, creating documents and presentations,searching for information and keeping records of your work. How confident are you with your computer skills?

answers.info: Great, that will make your life much easier, however, there is support available should you require it. Details here.
answers.label: Very

answers.info: If you find that you need to brush up on your skills there is plenty of support, details here.
answers.label: so so

answers.info: It is perfectly normal to be concerned about learning new technology for study. There is plenty of support, details here.
answers.label: not at all

lb-studyarea.text: Do you have a designated study area?

answers.info: Well done, study requires intense concentration so having a dedicated space to do this is really wonderful. There are also excellent facilities on campus that you are welcome to use. The helpdesk at the library can help you with this.
answers.label: I do

answers.info: Study requires intense concentration so having a dedicated space to do this is really important. There are excellent facilities on campus that you are welcome to use. The helpdesk at the library can help you with this.
answers.label: not yet

uhiw-keydates.text: There are a number of dates by which you need to have finalised enrolments, fees etc. They are shown in the Academic Calendar, are you aware of these?

answers.info: Please be aware of Census date. It is important to finalise your enrolment before census date so as you are not charged fees for subjects you do not wish to be enrolled in. The calendar can be found here (link)
answers.label: yes

answers.info: Please be aware of Census date. It is important to finalise your enrolment before census date so as you are not charged fees for subjects you do not wish to be enrolled in. The calendar can be found here (link)
answers.label: no

lb-travel.text: How far do you live from a campus location while you're studying?

answers.info: Attendance at class is really important if you are studying internally. We do encourage students studying externally to attend tutes if they live close to their campus.
answers.label: Greater than 30 mins

answers.info: In planning your studies you will need to think about managing your travel so that you can attend important things such as residential placements, practicum and possibly labs.
answers.label: less than 30 mins

p-unitprofiles.text: Do you know where to find Unit Profiles? These are provided by the lecturer in your subjects to provide you a guide to the subject.

answers.info: They are really important documents so make sure that you read them carefully.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: These are really important documents and you can find them on your learning management system, name of system and url here.

answers.info: These are really important documents and you can find them on your learning management system, name of system and url here.

answers.info: If you need further assistance other than student portal name please contact your academic liaison. Find out about them here link

lb-first.text: Are you the first in your family to go to uni?

answers.info: Congratulations we really welcome you to University. There are lots of supports available to help you, we will talk more about these later.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: You'll be able to talk to your family members about their university journey. Remember, every journey is different so there are lots of supports available on campus as well. We will be talking more about these later.

answers.info: That's good news, you will be using this constantly throughout your course.

answers.info: name of portal is an integral part of your study so please log as soon as possible. See here if you are having any trouble with this. You should have been given login instructions however they got instructions.

lb-finances.text: Lots of students worry about finances during their studies. Are finances a concern for you?

answers.info: There are some options like scholarships or student loans or you may be eligible for Centrelink. See contact info here for further information.
answers.label: yes

lb-studyload.text: Hi {lb-intro}. Our conversation today will look like this: ![conversation flow diagram](conversation.dot.png) (It's a very tall diagram, click it to see it more clearly.)&&How many [subjects/courses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Course_(education)) are you enrolled in this semester?

answers.info: 3 subjects or more is a full time load. A full-time study load is approximately 10 to 12 hours work per subject, per week. If you are working more than 20 hours per week we recommend a part time study load.
answers.label: 3 or more

p-placements2.text: Do you know where to find out about them?

answers.info: Go to your subject page and each unit/subject should have your details listed. If they are not indicated it could mean that they are not part of this unit/subject. You could check this with your unit/subject coordinator.
answers.label: no

p-placements3.text: Have you considered that you may need to travel for a residential school or to do a placement/practicum?

answers.info: Don't forget to budget for travel, accommodation and other expenses. You can talk to your lecturer about this.
answers.label: yes

answers.info: For many students this requires them to take time off work so start organising this as soon as possible. Don't forget to budget fortravel, accommodation and other expenses.
answers.label: no

p-placements1.text: Does your course have Residential Schools, Placements, or Practicums?

answers.info: These are a wonderful experiences of work integrated learning. Make sure you familiarise yourself with dates of placements so that you can plan ahead.
answers.label: yes

lb-intro.text: Sometimes students who commence the program tell us they find it difficult to achieve a _study/work/family/life_ balance.&&This may include balancing **full-time study** with **full-** or **part-time paid work**, as well as with _caring_ responsibilities.&&Is [study/life balance](https://onetwentyseven.blog/2017/11/29/choose-two/) a concern for you? Let's work through some examples, but first: what's your name?

p-requirements.text: Inherent requirements are the fundamental abilities, attributes, skills and behaviours necessary to complete the learning outcomes of a course. Do you think you understand all the inherent requirements for your course?

answers.info: Wonderful. Inherent and Course requirements make clear the expectations and requirements for your future study.
answers.label: yes
